Another suspenseful choice might be 'The Bourne Supremacy,' which follows the story of an amnesiac assassin framed for a CIA operation gone wrong. Matt Damon delivers an outstanding performance in this gripping thriller!

Based on your preference for thrillers, I'd recommend "The Ring Two" and "In Time".

"The Ring Two" is a chilling sequel to the original Japanese horror film, where new clues unveil a fresh evil lurking in the darkness. Starring Naomi Watts, it's a suspenseful thriller that keeps you on the edge of your seat.

On the other hand, "In Time" is a sci-fi thriller set in a future where time is currency. Justin Timberlake and Olivia Wilde star in this intriguing movie about a man on the run after being falsely accused of murder, exploring themes of wealth disparity and survival.

Alternatively, if you're interested in a high-action thriller with a modern twist, 'Live Free or Die Hard' might be right up your alley. This movie stars Bruce Willis as John McClane, who teams up with a young hacker to take down cyber-terrorists in Washington D.C."

I'd highly recommend "The Bad Seed" for you. This classic thriller from 1954 tells a chilling story about a seemingly innocent girl who may not be as sweet as she seems. Starring Frances Bavier, Paul Fix, and others, it could certainly scratch that thriller itch you've got going!

Another film I think you might enjoy is "Sin City" from 2005. This movie offers a unique blend of action, drama, and noir elements with an all-star cast including Mickey Rourke, Jessica Alba, and Bruce Willis. It's not as grounded in reality as Argo, but it shares that dark, suspenseful vibe!
